intro: Randia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered randia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Randia pauciflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
